important.para: Before you begin, you may encounter the following notification when trying to access the &ogw; front-end on the &dashboard;:
important.screen: Information No RGW credentials found, please consult the documentation on how to enable RGW for the dashboard. Please consult the documentation on how to configure and enable the Object Gateway management functionality.
important.para: This is because the &ogw; has not been automatically configured by &cephadm; for the &dashboard;. If you encounter this notification, follow the instructions at to manually enable the &ogw; front-end for the &dashboard;.

sect1.title: Viewing &ogw;s
sect1.para: To view a list of configured &ogw;s, click Object GatewayDaemons. The list includes the ID of the gateway, host name of the cluster node where the gateway daemon is running, and the gateway's version number.
Click the drop-down arrow next to the gateway's name to view detailed information about the gateway. The Performance Counters tab shows details about read/write operations and cache statistics.

sect1.title: Managing &ogw; users
sect1.para: Click Object GatewayUsers to view a list of existing &ogw; users.
Click the drop-down arrow next to the username to view details about the user account, such as status information or the user and bucket quota details.

sect2.title: Adding a new gateway user
sect2.para: To add a new gateway user, click Create in the top left of the table heading. Fill in their credentials, details about the S3 key and user and bucket quotas, then confirm with Create User.

sect2.title: Deleting gateway users
sect2.para: To delete a gateway user, select and highlight the user. Click the drop-down button next to Edit and select Delete from the list to delete the user account. Activate the Yes, I am sure check box and confirm with Delete user.

sect2.title: Editing gateway user details
sect2.para: To change gateway user details, select and highlight the user. Click Edit in the top left of the table heading.
Modify basic or additional user information, such as their capabilities, keys, sub-users, and quota information. Confirm with Edit User.

The Keys tab includes a read-only list of the gateway's users and their access and secret keys. To view the keys, click a user name in the list and then select Show in the top left of the table heading. In the S3 Key dialog, click the 'eye' icon to unveil the keys, or click the clipboard icon to copy the related key to the clipboard.

sect1.title: Managing the &ogw; buckets
sect1.para: &ogw; (OGW) buckets implement the functionality of &ostack; &swift; containers. &ogw; buckets serve as containers for storing data objects.
Click Object GatewayBuckets to view a list of &ogw; buckets.

sect2.title: Adding a new bucket
sect2.para: To add a new &ogw; bucket, click Create in the top left of the table heading. Enter the bucket's name, select the owner, and set the placement target. Confirm with Create Bucket.

note.para: At this stage you can also enable locking by selecting Enabled; however, this is configurable after creation. See for more information.

sect2.title: Viewing bucket details
sect2.para: To view detailed information about an &ogw; bucket, click the drop-down arrow next to the bucket name.

tip.title: Bucket quota
tip.para: Below the Details table, you can find details about the bucket quota and locking settings.

sect2.title: Editing the bucket
sect2.para: Select and highlight a bucket, then click Edit in the top left of the table heading.
You can update the owner of the bucket or enable versioning, multi-factor authentication or locking. Confirm any changes with Edit Bucket.

sect2.title: Deleting a bucket
sect2.para: To delete an &ogw; bucket, select and highligh the bucket. Click the drop-down button next to Edit and select Delete from the list to delete the bucket. Activate the Yes, I am sure check box and confirm with Delete bucket.
